The story about Dale Earnhardt Sr: removing a Confederate-flag sticker from his truck was shared by his daughter, Kelley Earnhardt Miller, not his son, Dale Jr.
The story originates from an episode of: Fast Lane Family" podcast, specifically the April 2015 episode featuring a Q&A with Kelley Earnhardt Miller about her father.
The podcast episode provides a firsthand: with Kelley Earnhardt Miller describing how her father removed the rebel flag from the sticker to avoid offending anyone.
Dale Earnhardt Jr: in a separate statement, expressed his opposition to the display of the Confederate flag, supporting NASCAR's decision to remove it and stating that it is offensive to an entire race.
